thread.title: Texas A&M Forest Service providing funds to multiple volunteer fire departments in South Plains
thread.title_full: Texas A&M Forest Service providing funds to multiple volunteer fire departments in South Plains

author: @KCBD11
title: Texas A&M Forest Service providing funds to multiple volunteer fire departments in South Plains
text:
Texas A&M Forest Service providing funds to multiple volunteer fire departments in South Plains
Published: Mar. 12, 2025 at 5:15 PM CDT|Updated: seconds ago
LUBBOCK, Texas (KCBD) - A handful of volunteer fire departments across the South Plains are getting some much needed support from the state.
The Texas A&M Forest Service is providing more than $2 million for crews across Texas. Idalou and Sudan are getting $25,000 for personal protective equipment.
It’s sending Petersburg and Littlefield $10,000 apiece for training aids and Shallowater will use its $25,000 to buy new fire and rescue equipment.
It’s all intended to help these volunteers protect their communities and respond to wildfire threats in our region and in other states.
